item.title: Ghana Wanted a Cathedral. It Got an ‘Expensive Hole’ Instead.
item.description: The nation had grand plans for a national cathedral designed by a celebrity architect. The $400 million project became a political battleground.

item.title: Message From the Russian Military: ‘We Lost Your Son’
item.description: Russia lacks any formal, organized effort to account for legions of missing soldiers. That often leaves relatives in limbo, fending for themselves wit...

item.title: How Trump Dismantled His First-Term Policy on Crimea
item.description: After more than three years of war, President Trump proposed a peace plan for Russia and Ukraine in late April that would have the United States recog...

item.title: In Singapore’s Election, All Eyes Are on the Margin of Victory, Not the Winner
item.description: The People’s Action Party is widely expected to continue its six-decade reign. But discontent with its policies is fueling a growing opposition.

item.title: Australia Election 2025: Voters Focus on Cost-of-Living Concerns Amid Global Turmoil
item.description: Voters will decide who can turn Australia around from the throes of inflation and a housing crisis, and navigate relations with a volatile Washington.
